manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Upgraded routing software with enhanced map displays, 3-D structures and junction views, and comprehensive, truck-specific points of interest.

Enhanced Truck-Specific Guidance Real-time traffic Avoid delays with real-time traffic and construction updates and view traffic patterns by time/day of the week — even in rural areas. Dynamic weather overlays Display the current forecast across your route with in-depth weather overlays that show precipitation, temperature, and wind speed. 3D buildings and landmarks Drivers can follow detailed routes consisting of 3-D renderings of nearby buildings and landmarks.

Current fuel prices Display gas station locations and current fuel prices along your route. Mileage and fuel logs Track fuel purchases and mileage to calculate fuel economy. On-screen alerts Set warnings for speed limit changes, sharp curves, and more.

TND 750 Highlights Driver tools TND 750 is equipped with the tools drivers need to get the job done. Routing is truck-specific, based on truck and trailer size and load type. The business of trucking is simplified mileage and fuel logs, and productivity can be monitored with an easy-to-view Virtual Dashboard. And, the TND 750 can be paired with a Rand McNally ELD using the pre-loaded DriverConnect app for compliant HOS -logging. Clean, modern interface A refreshed interface with new icons in bright, high-contrasting colors improves at-a-glance readability. TND 750’s 7-inch, high-resolution screen displays crystal-clear images. Advanced hardware With all new hardware, TND 750 is built for life on the road. A stronger magnetic mount keeps the device secure, while enhanced thermal resistance keeps the device protected. Powered by a hexa-core processor, the TND 750 offers quicker responses with silky-smooth graphics. Also, the device offers faster over-the-air updates and connections with improved Wi-Fi and Bluetooth capabilities.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best I have used
reviews.reviewText: Excellent device. Prior to this I had a Rand Mcnally TND 70 tablet. The tablet would glitch and freeze and eventually it stopped working. I had insurance on it but since they didn't make the TND 70 assurion issued a E gift card for Amazon. This TND 750 is a great tool. It's been fairly accurate. I like the upgraded map software, it's user friendly and has useful features. If your a trucker looking for a GPS I highly recommend the TND 750. I like how the most recent update you can check your ETA for either the current leg ( if doing multiple stops) or entire trip as well as the remaining time for both.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very neat gps
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded from the 740 after it stopped functioning all together after almost 3 years. The 750 takes a bit to getting used to, it’s very thick compared to the 740. The first thing you’ll notice is that it requires you to register your product so that you can receive updates. After updating the 750 right out of the box, I also noticed the new interface, the settings are easier to navigate and the device is packed with many new features. I’m loving this thing, it’s super smooth and fast! It has an auto brightness feature, which automatically dims the screen when it’s dark so the brightness doesn’t kill you and automatically brightens the screen when the sun is out so you can see. I’m super satisfied with this upgrade. I went with the bigger screen because I’m aware the interface takes up a lot of screen space and I like to see everything.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good, but not great.
reviews.reviewText: Alright here's the deal.For what it costs ($385) its excellent in what it offers and the quality but it does have its cons. It offers a lot of setting parameters that you would expect from a GPS aimed to assist truck drivers like height and width settings, bridge warnings, narrow roads, axle ratings, etc. It also comes with a anti-glare screen protector which is a nice touch. Its also setup like a tablet more than a GPS which is nice if you can maintain a wifi connection with it for media purposes and internet.Cons:-You have to be incredibly specific when putting in an address. This system is the biggest grammar nazi you'll ever encounter. Something as simple as not capitalizing a street name will result in it not finding your address.-The route it suggests is NEVER the fastest route so be warned. It will SPECIFICALLY stick to major highways which is fine but It may add 20 minutes to your trip.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for large trucks!
reviews.reviewText: This is the GPS you need if you drive a rig or towing a trailer. Nobody wants to be THAT person that goes down the wrong road and gets stick or causes a jam. The customizable options makes this a great option for anything you are towing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Worthless, don't buy this gps
reviews.reviewText: Oh boy where do I start? This gps sounded great on paper but it is awful! I bought it so I could use the weather feature but I can't get it to pair up to my hotspot or tether it to my Bluetooth. When I type in a legit company address it can't find it. So I end up typing in the city or town to get me in the right direction. Now mind you I have the company gps but its not great either, but 10,000 more times reliable than this POS! Even typing in a city this thing would get me lost if I didn't have a clue on where to go. If I followed this thing I would be getting off on every exit I pass and then getting back on the same highway I'm traveling on. Exit and enter same highway, hahahaha WTF?!? The graphics are good, but that's about all. I use it to show me upcoming turns, posted speeds and that's it. If I wasn't out on the road I would have returned it and bought a Garmin, but its past the 30 day return policy. I like the hell out of the Rand McNally 2023 laminated trucking map that I use often, but this gps is garbage. DON'T BUY IT!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I have been driving trucks for a long time and have always been a Garmin customer no matter what. But my last DEZL was a disgrace. It shut itself off, reset, switched screens, and did voice command on me. So I tried this unit, and I am so happy I did. Screen gives me so much data, clear route choices, weather and traffic updates, lane changes etc. It is accurate and the screen control for automatic brightness is spot on. So simple to use and it tracks each of my trips so I can document later. Well worth the money. I am now a Rand McNally guy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Bus Drivers - - Avoid the unit!
reviews.reviewText: I have driven charter buses for over 25 years; starting when there was but paper maps to rely upon.I have owned Garmin, Tom Tom and Magellan GPS devices. I bought my first Rand McNally in the days of model 730. The 730 won me over. The 750 has made me consider reverting to a Garmin OTR 1000.Those who report that the 750 takes you on-and-off highways are right. Happened to me several times. I look ahead on the 750 route overview and stay on the highway accordingly.That aside, the overall routing is not the worst. Garmin has led me astray, too. I guess it all boils down (for me) to what I see on the screen while driving. In that regard, I do favor Rand McNally I find Garmin is too sparse in detail for my likes.Buses take bumps like trucks. The mount has not failed me so long as I affix it to the windshield properly. I wish updates were more frequent and comprehensive. The weather and traffic functions suffice for my needs.The 750 (as can many truck Garmins) create bus profile. I do not believe any GPS exists that is perfect.If I were forced to make a choice on one device - - the Garmin OTR 1000 wins by a country mile.Happy Motoring Everyone!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars That it won't drive you off a CLIFF LIKE GOOGLE
reviews.reviewText: Boy!!!!this has saved my behind a few times I compared my Google to it on the road boy GOOGLE needs to stop or update there app! I'll never trust Google ever

Très satisfait, les indication son claire et précise, il nous guide étape par étape avec un excellent visuel des voies et sortie à prendre mais, lors du trajet si tu veux trouver un truck stop il faut annulé le trajet pour avoir accès aux différents point d'intérêts.

C’est mon cinquième produit Rand Mc Nally,j’ai eu les TND-710,720,730,740,TND-80 et maintenant le 750,le seul qui m’a déçu à été la TND-80 Tablet paquet de problème.Pour le 750 ultra satisfait fonctionne à merveille et assez précis une fois bien configuré,très bonne qualité audio et facile d’utilisation très bonne construction très solide,très satisfait qualité prix.
GPS works great but charging cable that comes with it doesn’t work and charging through usb doesn’t charge the gps fast enough so half way through the day the gps is dead

Parfait petit gps pour ceux qui commence su la route autant auto que camion par contre pour les camion encore une fois ne pas juste se fier au gps ;) il peux vous mettre dans des endroit assez serrer toujours garder un bon jugement et surtout n ayé pas peur de regarder l itinéraire avant de lancer le trajet !!!

reviews.reviewTitle: Stuck in Map update. Rendered useless as can't use keypad (blanked) while stuck @ 6.2GB
reviews.reviewText: Purchased in June 2022 from Amazon & this is the first map update conducted & has been stuck "downloading" for 3 days continuous.
